data.title: David L. Robbins
data.meta_description: CAPE NEDDICK, Maine — \u00a0David L. Robbins, 73, died unexpectedly on Tuesday, Dec. 9, 2014. He was born Oct. 31, 1941 in Lynn, Mass., a son of the late James E. and Mabelle (Fotens) Robbins. He was educ…
data.text:
CAPE NEDDICK, Maine — David L. Robbins, 73, died unexpectedly on Tuesday, Dec. 9, 2014. He was born Oct. 31, 1941 in Lynn, Mass., a son of the late James E. and Mabelle (Fotens) Robbins. He was educated in the Lynn school system and went on to Salem State College. Dave was loved by all who met him. Besides his love of his family, he was an avid outdoorsman. He was known to be at the York Harbor on his boat, "The Lady in Red II." During the winter he enjoyed skiing and teaching the younger generations how to ski. He was a proud member of the York Harbor Board and volunteered at the York Food Pantry and Table of Plenty.

He is survived by his soul mate and wife of 22 years, Lorraine D. (Toto) Robbins; three sons, David, Gregory, and Douglas; a daughter, Meredith; a step-son, Anthony R. Carrillo Jr.; a step-daughter, Gina Delucia; 11 grandchildren, 3 sisters, and many nieces and nephews.

SERVICES: Calling hours will be held from 3 to 6 p.m. on Sunday, Dec. 14, 2014 in the Lucas & Eaton Funeral Home, 91 Long Sands Rd. York, ME. A funeral Mass will be celebrated at 10 a.m. on Monday, Dec. 15, in St. Christopher's Church, 4 Barrell Lane, York, ME. Burial will take place at 1:30 p.m. in Oak Grove Cemetery, 230 Playstead Rd. Medford, MA. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to St. Jude Children's Research Hospital, www.stjude.org, or Huntington's Disease Society of America, 6 Boston Rd. Suite 203A Chelmsford, MA 01824, hdsa.org. Visit www.lucaseatonfuneralhome.com.
